## Code is neatly formatted.
_______________________________
As a good coding practice your code must be **neatly formatted**, **clean**,  **maintainable** and **easy to read** for other programmers. For example:

![1.png](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/3576/1494601839/1.png)



## Suggestions:
- 1) **INDENTING**
**Indenting** your code makes it much more readable. This is a very important habit to have because it makes your code much more maintainable.
_________________________

- 2) **MULTIPLE LINES**
When you have a piece of text longer than 79 characters it's considered good practice break this text in multiple lines.  For example:

### Bad:
![1.png](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/3576/1494605602/1.png)
### Good:
![Screenshot from 2017-05-12 10-10-00.png](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/3576/1494605420/Screenshot_from_2017-05-12_10-10-00.png)
________________________
- 3) **URL**
**URLS** are an exception. Don't split a url over two lines because it makes the urls hard to read, the instead add the comment # NOQA
(The comment # noqa lets you skip error in tools such asPEP 8 online,)

![1.png](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/3576/1494606675/1.png)

________________________________

- 4) **PEP8**
I recommend pass your code through the on-line tool [ PEP8 checker](http://pep8online.com/)

### I hope you find the feedback useful :smile:
Good work importing the modules. A module allows you to logically organize your Python code. Grouping related code into a module makes the code easier to understand and use.

## Comments effectively explain longer code procedures.
____________________________
The true value of commenting and having a clean code is that it makes our code easier to keep, reducing the time for other programmers to understand.

- Please take the time to comment your **`Instances`** to meet the specs.
Good job :smiley:, your code works pretty well and is error free :movie_camera:.
